_exec_summary.SummaryText:
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY



Saputo Dairy Foods USA, LLC - Gustine, California has developed, implemented and updated its Risk Management Program (RMP) and Prevention Program 3 in accordance with the standards of the California Accidental Release Prevention (CalARP) program (Title 19, CCR Division 2, Chapter 4.5).



The executive summary is comprised of the following sections which are summarized below.



1.    Accidental release prevention and emergency response policies

2.    Facility information and regulated substances

3.    General accidental release prevention program and chemical-specific prevention

4.    Five-year accident history

5.    Emergency response program

6.    Planned changes to improve safety



1.    ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES



Saputo is strongly committed to employee, public and environmental safety. This commitment is inherent to a comprehensive accidental release prevention program in place that covers areas such as design, installation, operating procedures, maintenance, and employee training associated with the processes at our facility. It is our policy to implement appropriate controls to prevent possible releases of regulated substances. If such a release does occur, our employees are trained to follow the Emergency Action Plan and to evacuate the facility as necessary. We are also coordinated with the City of Gustine Fire Department and the Merced County Environmental Health which provides additional emergency response expertise.





2.    FACILITY INFORMATION & REGULATED SUBSTANCES



The Saputo Cheese USA Inc. - Gustine facility is located at 299 5th Ave, Gustine, CA 95322. The plant's primary products include extended shelf life and aseptic dairy and non-dairy food products. The facility employs approximately 255 full-time employees. There is one RMP-regulated substance, anhydrous ammonia, used in the plant's refrigeration system to provide refrigeration for processing and cold storage of dairy food products. This system c

ontains 22,650 lbs. of anhydrous ammonia.







 

3.    GENERAL ACCIDENTAL RELEASE & CHEMICAL-SPECIFIC PREVENTION



The Saputo Diary Foods USA, LLC - Gustine plant follows the elements of the CalARP Prevention Program 3 as a release prevention program for the RMP. In addition, Saputo Corporate - Department of Refrigeration Services works with the plant confirming regulatory and corporate standards are being followed, providing guidance and standardization on the CalARP program and acting as a resource for the plant on the CalARP, EPA RMP, OSHA PSM and other environmental programs.





4.    FIVE-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY



The Saputo Dairy Foods USA, LLC - Gustine plant has had a good record of preventing accidental releases over the last five years. Due to our release prevention policies, no incidents, as defined by the RMP rule, have occurred in the past five years.



5.  EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM



Saputo Dairy Foods USA, LLC - Gustine developed an Emergency Action Plan to deal with accidental releases of hazardous materials as well as other emergency events that might occur at the plant. The purpose of Saputo's Emergency Action Plan is to ensure employees know and understand what to do in the event of an emergency in order to minimize injuries and property damage. The plan includes various aspects of an emergency including adequate first aid and medical treatment, evacuations, and notification of local emergency response agencies. Specific employees are trained and certified as medical responders. All employees are trained in evacuation, hazard communication, and chemical safety. In addition, the plan is promptly updated to reflect pertinent changes.





6.    PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY



Several developments and findings have resulted from the implementation of the various elements of our accidental release prevention program. Recommendations resulting from the Process Hazard Analysis (PHA), compliance audits, seismic assessments and mechanical integr

ity inspections will be addressed in a timely manner. In addition, regular interaction with Saputo Corporate - Department of Refrigeration Services, Health & Safety and Risk Group will improve compliance and overall plant safety
